intro: Phucagrostis major, commonly known as the common grassvetch, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Phucagrostis major plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for various herbivorous animals.
